fields.description:
Steps to replicate :
# Go to Team Calendar
# Create a Calendar
# Create an event
# When you create an event choose a different start or end date by clicking on the date
# You should be presented a datepicker as per the screenshot below :
!datePicker.jpg|thumbnail!

*Current behavior* : Unable to select different date from the date picker
*Expected behavior* : Able to select different date from the date picker

*Workaround* : Manually type the date instead of selecting from the date picker
OR - Type the Date into a text editor and copy/paste it into the Datepicker field
fields.summary: Unable to select different dates from the datepicker

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you upload a PDF file to a Confluence page, set a link to display the file on Confluence and click to display it, it will load until you receive an error that the file was not able to be loaded.

This happens only with Internet Explorer 11, in Windows 7 environment.
h3. Environment
Cloud Confluence 1000.809.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a PDF file to a page
# Create a link to the file in the page
# Click it to preview it, open it

h3. Expected Results
The file should open 
h3. Actual Results
Not able to display the file on Confluence
h3.Workaround
Use another browser like Chrome
*(Please, see attachment)*
fields.summary: Not able to open PDF's in Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary

cannot use the short cut key cmd + shift + b after enabling collaborative editing with Chrome.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud version Confluence + Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Collaborative editing
 # Create a new page with Chrome browser
 # Input title and Save
 # Edit the page again with collaborative editing by over 2 users
 # Press cmd + shift + b on the 1st line
 *NOTE* nothing to do after inputing the title.

h3. Expected Results

{{cmd + shift + b}} can be used on editor
h3. Actual Results

{{cmd + shift + b}} cannot be used on editor
fields.summary: cannot use the short cut key cmd + shift + b after enabling collaborative editing with Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Issue Macro Repair feature delete some of the content

h3. How to replicate
# Space or Site import to the Confluence Cloud instance
# If Confluence detects there is any broken link, there will be a button off *Next Step* there.
# If we click on *What's Next* button, Confluence will redirect us automatically to *JIRA Macro Repair* feature.
# If user didn't perform any import, Confluence still can detect any broken link and can still perform JIRA Macro Repair, by accessing this page {{https://(instance_name)/wiki/admin/jim-validator/view.action}}

h3. Actual Result
Performing JIRA Macro Repair will remove some of the content insides the page. We see that the content inside *View File Macro*, *Panel*, *Anchor* and several of macros will be removed after we perform the JIRA Macro Repair

h3. Expected Result
The content should not be removed

h3. Workaround
Revert the page that gets affected by JIRA Macro Repair to the previous version.
fields.summary: JIRA Macro Repair remove some of the content in Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Export page to PDF does not include Gliffy diagram

h3. How to replicate
# Create a Gliffy diagram in Confluence page.
# Export the page into PDF

h3. Expected behaviour
The Gliffy diagram should be included inside the PDF

h3. Actual behaviour
The Gliffy diagram is not included inside the PDF

h3. Workaround.
No workaround for this moment. We will update this ticket if any in the future.
fields.summary: Export page to PDF does not include Gliffy diagram

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Multi-byte characters in text file are garbled when previewing it in a page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Drag/Drop a text file (.txt) to the page when editing the page
# Save the page
# Click the text file in the page and preview it

h3. Expected Results

Multi-byte characters in the text file should be shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results

Multi-byte characters in the text file were garbled as follows.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

Previewing text file seems to be *Cloud Only* feature at this moment. (Please see CONF-36508 for the details.)

h3.Workaround

Right click the text file in the page and use "Open link in New Tab" feature provided by browser instead.
fields.summary: Multi-byte characters in text file are garbled when previewing it in a page

fields.description: When using the content rest API to render content, if the content contains a task list, then the task list checkboxes are not shown in the output and tasks cannot be marked as completed.
fields.summary: Tasks lists are not rendered correctly when using the content rest API

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to create a page via Blueprints, error is thrown.
{quote}
*We can't create that blueprint right now.*
org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not execute statement; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.HibernateException: org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not execute statement
{quote}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.536.1
* Atlassian Connect add-ons

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Gliffy (or any Atlassian Connect add-ons)
# Click *...* beside "Create" button at top of page
# Search for "Gliffy Diagram" 
# Click on Gliffy Diagram
# Click "Create"

h3. Expected Results
Go to page editor.

h3. Actual Results
Error message is thrown:
!Screenshot.png|thumbnail!

In the log:

{noformat}

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.

When querying [https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=type%3Duser&start=0&limit=100&expand=user.details]

fields.description:
*Summary:*

Users that have the Confluence usage status add-on enabled can't see the graphical chart.

 

As it supposed to show https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/viewing-site-statistics-123043962.html

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Enable the add-on
# Navigate to the Global Activity page in the administration section of Confluence.
# Note an error in the page "Error formatting macro: chart: java.lang.NullPointerException"



*Expected Results:*
A chart with the actual results in a graph.

*Actual Results:*
Just an error is thrown and no graph are generated.

*Workaround:*



No Workaround so far.

 

*Affects Version:*

Confluence Cloud 1000.518.2
fields.summary: Confluence Add-on Usage Stats is throwing an error

fields.description:
*This is only happening with Confluence Cloud New User Interface a.k.a SPA, if you're using server or your Confluence Cloud hasn't changed yet, please disregard*

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click the watch button on a page.
2. Click "manage watchers" 

Expected behaviour
Dialog shows, allowing you to manage watchers

Actual behaviour
Nothing happens

Workaround:
Not yet
fields.summary: Manage Watchers button Not working in the New Confluence Cloud User Interface (SPA)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inline Styles used in Span Macro doesn't work.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.322.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page and add Span Macro
# Set the Class to {{vtRed}}; Set the Style to {{color: #C5161D;}}

h3. Expected Results
* It should apply the inline sytles configured, to change the color of the text to red.


h3. Actual Results
* The preview will apply the custom-color but it will not apply when you save the page.
fields.summary: Inline Styles not working in Span Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Space Categories can't be removed once added in Confluence.
Clicking in the "X" icon besides the label simply does nothing.

h3. Environment
 !cateogires.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Space
# Put a category in the space
# Try to delete

h3. Expected Results
The label gets removed

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens and there are no errors in the logs or console.
 
h3. Workaround
Not available yet.
fields.summary: Space Categories can't be removed once added

fields.description:
h2. Steps to Replicate
 * Create a space name call *include*
 * Inside the space create a page name *KB-Footer*
 * Add the following in the page and save it

 
----
*© Test 2014-2016*  - All the information is provided on the best effort basis, and might be changed anytime without notice. Information provided does not mean Test commitment to any features described.

 
 * Create a new space call *Test*
 * Go to space tools > Look and Feel > Sidebar, header and footer
 * Add the following in footer and click save
{code:java}{include:IN:KB-Footer|nopanel=true}
{code}

 * Go to the pages and click edit then click preview

h2. Observed Behaviour

!footer.png|thumbnail!
h2. Expected Behaviour

 The page should be shown in one page instead of double side.
fields.summary: Edit Page preview layout issue
Jira service desk customer unable to add comment in confluence space

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Several macros provided by the {{Confluence Content Formatting}} are no longer available in Confluence Cloud. Users that had this plugin are reporting broken macros.

These macros include:
# colgroup
# Lozenge
# RoundRect
# Searchbox
# HTML Image
# align

h3. Environment
Affected version: 1000.444.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to add any of the macros above
# Or open a page that have one of them

h3. Expected Results
The macros can be added or viewed.

h3. Actual Results
Macro is not available to be added. Macros that were added before are showing 'XML' directly in the UI (when editing we do see the macros though).
 

h3.Workaround
No workaround yet.
fields.summary: Macros from 'Confluence Content Formatting' originally from Adaptavist are not longer available

fields.description: When using the content rest API, if the content contains an "@-mention" of a user, then the mention is not rendered correctly
fields.summary: Mentions are not rendered correctly when using the content rest API

fields.description:
h2. Problem

When viewing a word file that contains Korean Character, the Korean characters are not showing but a 'block' character is showing instead.

 

!image.png|thumbnail!
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Upload a word doc that contains Korean character
 # Save
 # View the file

h2. Expected

All characters are showing properly
h2. Actual

Korean characters are not showing
h2. Workaround

Use Word Office Macro instead.
 # Edit the page
 # Click on +
 # Find Office and select Word
 # Attach the word doc
fields.summary: Korean Character are not showing properly when viewing a Word Document in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence refuses to start with UnexpectedRollbackException: Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse /wiki

h3. Expected Results
Confluence loads

h3. Actual Results
 !Errors.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
A dedicated team has been working on the problem and still addressing the problem.

h3.Workaround
Cloud Support is applying a fix but feel free to get in contact if your site is not recovered.
fields.summary: Confluence refuses to start

fields.description: Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a page with REST APIs that contains a assigned task. For example, adjust the following to your local Confluence instance: {code}curl -u user:password -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d'{"type":"page","title":"Rest API task test","space":{"key":"HOME"},"body":{"storage":{"value":"\n\n1\nincomplete\n to test REST API create page with task problem\n\n","representation":"storage"}}}' https://meliae.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/ {code} 2. On another page create a tasks-report-macro (manually or via REST APIs) to report on the tasks from the other page 3. The report is empty 4. Go to tasks page and edit/save the page 5. Go back to report page to see that the task is now listed The thing to notice is the space between `` and `
fields.summary: Valid XML structure prevents creating a task

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Uploading an attachment using drag and drop does not upload the attachment but open it in the browser.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.444.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Drag and drop an attachment to upload it.

h3. Expected Results
The attachment is uploaded.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is opened in the web browser but do not get attached.

h3.Workaround
Use the other method to upload attachments.
fields.summary: Drag and dropping attachment in Confluence does not upload but open the attachment in the browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary HTML Macros are not rendering properly. h3. Environment (Optional - If Applicable) h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new Confluence page. $ Create an HTML macro with the following structure:   {code:java}                                
Head 1
Head 2
Head 3
123
{code} h3. Expected Results Table should look like this:   !Screen Shot 2016-12-29 at 1.15.38 PM.png|width=163,height=76! h3. Actual Results The headers will appear at the top of the page, outside of the table: !Screen Shot 2016-12-29 at 1.15.50 PM.png|width=110,height=107! h3. Workaround The best workaround is to use the [inbuilt table functionality|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Tables] in Confluence.
fields.summary: HTML Table headers display incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Page Properties Report macro doesn't work if the user sets additional CQL to restrict the pages shown in the report for only the child pages of the one holding the report.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a page tree like this, for example:
* Parent
** Child 1
** Child 2
*** ChildofChild
# Put a common label on them
# Set Page properties for all the pages
# Create a Page properties report and use an additional filter of type "With parent" = "current page"
h3. Expected Results
The report should work just fine and present the pages correctly.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't load the report at page loading time.
It renders correctly at preview, however.

h3.Workaround
Remove the additional filter if possible: "With parent" = "current page"
fields.summary: Page properties report macro doesn't work when using Parent page as current page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When exporting a page with code block content, the pdf file would not display the proper formatting for Code block
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a page and add code block
 * Add the following in code block

{code:java}"customer" : { "firstName": "Suren", "lastName" : "Raj" "emailAddress" : "test@yahoo.com", "telephoneNumber" : "12345678", "telephoneNumberHash" : "OTgyMTg2MDc3MQ==" "gender" : "male" }

{code}
 * Configure the code block with the following configuration
 !code.png!
 * Save the confluence page
 * Export the page to pdf

h3. Expected Results

User should be seeing the following

!code2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

User seeing the following

!code1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: PDF export for Code Block missing the formatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Page does not appear on the page tree, and attempts to create a child page under the said page results in the same behaviour (missing page in page tree)
h3. Environment

Occurs on instances with collaborative editing enabled
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page, in the create page dialog, *do not publish!* wait til the draft is saved
 # Then resume editing the draft from {{Profile >> Drafts}}
 # While in the edit screen, hit the *Create* button to create a totally new page
 # Save the page that's created, and notice that this page is not shown in the Page Tree

h3. Expected Results

Page should be shown in the page tree, with the parent page set to the originally created page (and not the draft)
h3. Actual Results

Page is missing from the page tree, and the page's parent is actually a draft
  
h3. Notes

Run this query in the Confluence Database to verify that you are affected by this issue:
{code:java}select * from content where parentid in (SELECT contentid from content where content_status = 'draft');{code}
Should preferably return 0 rows.
h3. Workaround

Navigate to the page affected by this, and hit on *Move*, then set the page to a valid parent
fields.summary: Page does not show on page tree, and parent page is set to a draft

fields.description:

Table added inside a Center Macro is not alligned. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 1000.690.2
Confluence 1000.842.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add a *Center Macro*
# Add a table  inside this macro

h3. Expected Results
* The Table is not center alligned

h3. Actual Results
* The Table should be center alligned
 
h3.Workaround
No Workaround
fields.summary: Center Macro does not Align Table

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "K" shortcut that should bring the link page dialog is not working in the new Confluence interface.

h3. Environment
Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page in the new interface.
# In the page view, press K

h3. Expected Results
The Link Page dialog should appear.

h3. Actual Results
The user gets redirected to a different page.
 
h3.Workaround
Not available.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever you cut a line from a bulleted list and add it back to the list, an extra bullet is added to the list

h3. Environment

* Confluence 1000.340.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add 3 bulleted lines of text
# Select the last line and cut it (ctrl + x or cmd + x)
# After the first bulleted line, add a new line and paste the line you previously cut

h3. Expected Results

The cut line is pasted with only one bullet

h3. Actual Results

The cut line is pasted with an extra bullet

h3. Notes

Attached .MOV file showing issue

h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Cutting and pasting a line in bulleted list adds extra bullet

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Exporting pages to PDF does not show the progress of the operation. All we get is the progress going from zero to 100% regardless of how long the export process takes or how large the page is.

h3. Environment
Replicated it in two different environments:
Confluence Cloud - 1000.842.0
Confluence Cloud - 1000.847.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
It should show something in between the start and completion of the export

h3. Actual Results
It only shows something when it is completed (at 100%)
fields.summary: Page PDF export doesn't show progress

fields.description: When using the rest API to render content, if the content has a page layout, the page layout is not preserved.
fields.summary: Content layout not working when using rest API
Unable to sort by more than one field when making a CQL search by REST

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When filtering on *with parent = current page* or *with ancestor = current page* The Page Property Report macro displays {{No content found.}}

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.801.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence
# Create child pages, add the same label to all of them.
# On the first page you created, add Page Property Report macro.
# Set to use the label from earlier, and With Parent = Current page.


h3. Expected Results
Should display all child pages with the label

h3. Actual Results
Shows {{No content found}}
If you were to actually look at the preview in edit mode, it *does* display results.
 
h3. Notes
This was working prior to this week.

h3.Workaround
Instead of choosing *current page*, type the name of the current page and select it. The page properties report macro will display properly.
fields.summary: Filtering by current page displays no results in Page Property Report Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
"Configure side bar" button keep spinning

h3. How to replicate it
# Access any of the page in any Confluence Space
# Click on *Space Tools* button -> Click on *Configure side bar* button at the right side bar

h3. Actual result
The process will keep spinning

h3. Expected Result
The configuration mode will be available

Workaround
There is no workaround for this moment.
fields.summary: "Configure side bar" button keep spinning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Backup fails due because can't find the internal directory.

h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence 1000.847.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Try to create a backup with attachments in Confluence Backup Manager

h3. Expected Results
The backup should be created

h3. Actual Results
Export error
Directory does not exist
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
 
h3.Workaround
Export Space by Space
fields.summary: Confluence Backup Error - Can't find Confluence Internal Directory

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence page when users edit a page with expand macros, extra line breaks automatically appear between the first expand macro and second expand macro.


h3. Environment
* Confluence version 1000.340.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable Collaborative Editing plugin
# Create a page with 2 expand macros
# Save the page
# Enable Collaborative Editing
# Go to the page created in step 2

h3. Actual Results
Extra line break automatically added

h3. Expected Results
No extra line break between the macro.
fields.summary: Extra line break added when adding expand macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a variable name has special characters (such as '´') in it and the type *list*, the content of the list will be cleared after saving the template.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/Edit a template
# Insert a new variable and choose a name which includes a special characters
# Choose the type *list* for your new variable and fill in the list items.

h3. Expected Results
The items list is saved when using the page template.

h3. Actual Results
The items list is cleared upon save and the variable displays blank content when trying to select the value from the list.
 
h3.Workaround
Do not use special characters in your variable name.
fields.summary: Template variables do not work with special characters

fields.summary: Error during flush in /rest/api/content rest api for custom content

fields.description:
Confluence is duplicating the boards for different filters instead of showing the correct data for each filter.

 

Steps to reproduce

1- Setup two filter as in the picture below:

!Screen Shot 2016-12-09 at 16.30.18.png|thumbnail! 

\{jiraissues:cache=false|columns=key;summary;failure cause;failure effects;control;likelihood of occurrence;likelihood of detection;severity;rpn;issuelinks|url=[https://flyzipline.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=project+%3D+RRT+and+issuetype+%3D+Risk+and+labels+%3D+fault_tolerance+and+labels+%3D+airdata_sensors]}

\{jiraissues:cache=false|columns=key;summary;description|url=[https://flyzipline.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=project+%3D+RRT+and+issuetype+%3D+Verification+and+labels+%3D+fault_tolerance+and+labels+%3D+airdata_sensors]

2- On the preview screen the data returned by each filter will show up correctly.

3- After clicking the 'save' button, the data returned by the filters will be duplicated.
fields.summary: Confluence not showing correct output for JIRA issues macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not always does the Table of Context excludes correctly the 'exclude regex' from the search. For example, the regex '^(?![\s\t\w]*$).+}', which should eliminate titles only with spaces, tabs, etc. useful to remove unnecessary titles, works in 'preview' view, but not after we save the page.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 4 sections in a page
# Add in 3 'h1' headings with text, and h2 in another
# Add a ToC in the other section and add an 'almost empty' h1 heading (with only a space in the title) in this section
#* Make sure to select the space and see if it's heading 1
# Add remove regex: '^(?![\s\t\w]*$).+'
# Check if the empty header is included in ToC

h3. Expected Results
It does not include the heading with a single space in preview mode or after saving the page.

h3. Actual Results
It's excluded from the preview mode, but not when we save the page.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Specific exclude regex in ToC is not working in view page mode, but is in preview

fields.description:
h3. Summary

- Executing a site backup on Confluence results in the following error in the UI.

{quote}Export error
Unsupported field: InstantSeconds
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.{quote}

h3. Version not listed Confluence 1000.847.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Backup Manager
 # Tick option to Include attachments
 # Click on "Create Backup"

h3. Expected Results

Confluence Backup completes and a link is displayed to download the full backup zip file.

h3. Actual Results

Entries for that months are visible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Global Activity graph doesn't show, only shows: Most popular spaces (Views), Most active spaces (Edits) and Most active contributors (Edits).

h3. Environment
Cloud - Confluence v1000.722.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Enable the Confluence Usage Stats (Must be system-admin) add-on.
* Go to General Configuration
* Scroll down the left panel menu and click on Global Activity

h3. Expected Results
Graphs showing statistics for Confluence pages/blogs.

h3. Actual Results
Cannot render chart outside a page
This graph shows how many times pages and blog posts have been viewed over the current time period.
Cannot render chart outside a page
This graph shows how many pages, blog posts and comments have been created or updated over the current time period.

h3. Notes
Tested in different prod instances. All presented the same behaviour. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Global Activity graph doesn't show

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If we add an Office Connector macro to a Confluence page, the header is no longer fixed (that is, it doesn't follow the page as we scroll down).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add enough text so you can scroll down
# Scroll down (test 1)
# Create a {{.xlsx}} file with any text data and attach to page
# Add a Excel macro (+ >> Other Macros >> Office Excel) and select the attachment
# Save the page and notice that the spreadsheet is displayed
# Scroll down again (test 2)

h3. Expected Results
In both test 1 and test 2, the top menu bar follows the page as it's scrolled down, so you can select 'Spaces', 'People', etc. even on the bottom of the page.

h3. Actual Results
The top menu remains on the top.
 
h3. Notes
This seems to be due to the {{<style>}} tag that is added by the Office macro.

h3.Workaround
You can use 'Insert files and images' instead, which does not cause this issue.
fields.summary: Office Connector macros may cause fixed header to be disabled
Confluence Backup Error - Can't find Confluence Internal Directory

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to go to previous page after clicking on a JIRA issue macro link in a panel with table display

h3. Environment
* Confluence {{1000.536.1}}
* JIRA {{1000.571.2}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an empty page in Confluence
# Add a Panel
# Inside the Panel, add JIRA Issues Macro
# Use any search query. Edit the "Display Options" to be displayed as *Table*. Then click "Insert".
# Save the page.
# Click on the JIRA issue link on the panel.
# Once the JIRA issue is loaded, click on the browser's "Back" button.

h3. Expected Results
To be navigated back to the Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
The JIRA issue flashes for a second and doesn't go back to the previous page.

h3. Notes
Seems to affect the latest stable version of Chrome, Safari & Firefox

h3.Workaround
* Hold down/right-click the ‘back page’ button and then select the Confluence page you were on; OR
* Click on the Confluence page that is linked on the JIRA Issue itself
fields.summary: Unable to go to previous page after clicking on a JIRA issue macro link in a panel with table display

h3. Summary

When using shift + up arrow key to select text from the bottom up and then applying bullets, it will apply bullet to the above line even though it's not selected

h3. Environment

* JIRA Cloud v1000.362.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a new Confluence page, add a single line of text, followed by 3 lines of bulleted text
# Click to place cursor at end of line 3
# Hold shift and press up arrow on keyboard to select the lines of bulleted text
# Press bullet button twice

h3. Expected Results

Only highlighted lines are effected

h3. Actual Results

Line above bulleted text is effected and has bullet added
 
h3.Workaround

* Highlight text by clicking and dragging instead
fields.summary: Bullets are applied to extra lines

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Draw.io figures are not being rendered as centred, only aligned to the left side of a confluence page.

h3. Environment

* Tested in confluence cloud
* Subscribe to draw.io plugin to enable it

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a draw.io figure on a page
# Center it (using wiki-style formatting buttons or even the 'center macro')

h3. Expected Results
Draw.io figures should be centered on the page

h3. Actual Results
Figures are aligned to the left always. In fact, due to the Iframe, it won't obey to any allignment or wiki-markup configurations.

h3. Notes
This was reported from a costumer, who also contact draw.io support which left us the following note:
{quote}
"Unfortunately, there is no technical means for us to fix this, currently. draw.io is within an iFrame and we don't have the access to the information we need from the parent frame to center."
{quote}
fields.summary: Draw.io figures are not able to be centered.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The quick issue creation in Confluence is not working as expected when the user is trying to create multiple issues at the same time from a table linking them to an Epic that's in page.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project in JIRA with the Epic type available
# Create a page in Confluence with a sample table data (you can use this one: http://www.okstate.edu/sas/v8/sashtml/accdb/z0389375.htm - customers table data)
# Create an Epic in the JIRA Project using the quick issue creation.
# Highlight the content in the table and select to create multiple issues from the table in the Confluence page using the quick create issue.
# Keep the link to Epic checked.
# Click Create:

h3. Expected Results
The issues would be created in JIRA and the Confluence page would be updated with the JIRA issue macros on it.

h3. Actual Results
The issues are not created and the following error appears on screen:
{code}
There were errors creating issues in JIRA.
The server may be unreachable. Please ensure you are running JIRA 5.0 or higher.
{code}
In Confluence logs the following error message can be seen:
{code}
2016-10-20 16:59:21.386063500 2016-10-20 16:59:21,383 WARN [http-bio-1994-exec-16] [internal.integration.jira.DefaultJiraService] communicateWithJira Problem communicating with JIRA: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
2016-10-20 16:59:21.386064500  -- referer: https://jacksparrow.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JSD/Testing+things | url: /wiki/rest/jira-integration/1.0/issues | traceId: 52ad42a5d0d673e0 | userName: sysadmin
2016-10-20 16:59:21.788016500 2016-10-20 16:59:21,781 WARN [http-bio-1994-exec-14] [com.launchdarkly.client.LDClient] evaluate Unknown feature flag confluence.confluence.amq.synchronous; returning default value: 
2016-10-20 16:59:21.788018500  -- url: /wiki/display/JSD/Testing+things | page: 2883590 | traceId: 6c6fe33767434fd0 | userName: sysadmin | referer: https://jacksparrow.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JSD/Testing+things | action: viewpage
2016-10-20 16:59:21.788060500 2016-10-20 16:59:21,786 INFO [http-bio-1994-exec-14] [confluence.impl.featureflag.DefaultFeatureFlagServiceClient] lambda$getBooleanValue$3 FFS Key: confluence.amq.synchronous Value: false Duration: 4697583
{code}

h3.Workaround
Creating just a few issues at the same time (tested with 4) usually works.
fields.summary: Quick issue creation in Confluence doesn't work for average sized tables

h3. Summary

Page Properties macro not sorting accordingly.
h3. How to Replicate

1. Create a page name *Main* 
 2. Create a child page name *A* and add page properties then lable the page *test*. Inside the page properties add the following table
|Ikon|Test|
|Arbeidsflyt|Artikkel|
|url|(/)|
|sitemap|(/)|

3. Create a child page name *B* and add page properties then lable the page *test*. Inside the page properties add the following table
|Ikon|Test|
|Arbeidsflyt|Artikkel|
|url|(/)|
|sitemap|(/)|

4. Create a child page name *C* and add page properties then lable the page *test*. Inside the page properties add the following table
|Ikon|Ok|
|Arbeidsflyt|Artikkel|
|url|(x)|
|sitemap|(/)|

5. Create a child page name *D* and add page properties then lable the page *test*. Inside the page properties add the following table
|Ikon|ohh|
|Arbeidsflyt|Artikkel|
|url|(/)|
|sitemap|(/)|

6. Create a child page name *E* and add page properties then lable the page *test*. Inside the page properties add the following table
|Ikon|Test|
|Arbeidsflyt|Artikkel|
|url|(x)|
|sitemap|(/)|

7. Go the page you created in step 1 and add page property report macro, click edit macro and add the following details:
|Label|Test|
|In Space|Current Space|

8. Save the page.
 9. Go to *url* column and sort it. 
h3.  
h3. Observed Behaviour

You will notice the (x) for page c and e are not sort together.
h3.  
h3.  Expected Behaviour

(x) for page c and e should be arrange together when user sort for column *URL*

h2. Attention:
This issue tracks the icon sorting specifically. For general sorting issue, please watch https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-54883.

h3. Summary
User seeing the following error when creating confluence backup.
{code:java}
Export error
Failed to upload application/zip file to filestore. Failure: Failure
{cause=null, reason=BAD_STATUS, message='', httpStatusCode=413}{code}

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a backup or a large Confluence site

h3. Expected Results
The backup completes and a file link to download is displayed on screen.

h3. Actual Results
The backup completes but the file fails to be uploaded to a location where it can be downloaded from

h3. Notes
The bahaviour is similar to the fixed bug [CONF-45041|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-45041] but the cause is now error *413* instead of *500*

Creating a backup without attachments may work as the file is significantly smaller.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sometimes when a user navigates to a page in Confluence with an anchor in the URL, the jump to the anchored text will sometimes pass the line of text the anchor is linked to.

h3. Environment
Using different browsers has no impact, and this has been tested in both Server and Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a long page with an anchor in the middle of the page/content
2. Load page with normal url: http://instanceurl.atlassian.net/wiki/testpage
3. Do not scroll around on the page
4. Change URL in browser to the anchor URL: http://http://instanceurl.atlassian.net/wiki/display/space/testpage#testpage-anchor
5. Press enter
6. The jump to the anchor does not line up
7. If I press "enter" on the URL bar again, reloading the page (also without changing the scrolling) it misses again
8. If i press "enter" on the URL bar a third time, it loads to the correct spot

The behavior seems somewhat random and unpredictable, but it should be fairly easy to reproduce.

h3. Expected Results
The anchor link should line up with the text tied to that anchor

h3. Actual Results
The anchor sometimes jumps to an unexpected position on the page

h3. Workaround
No workaround at this time
fields.summary: Page Anchor Links Position Incorrectly When Used

h3. Summary

Extra lines are added to the page when creating it from a custom or edited blueprint

h3. Environment

* Google Chrome 
* Confluence Cloud
* Collaborative Editing must be on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Download a blueprint or edit a system one (e.g Meeting notes)
# Create a page using the template

h3. Expected Results

The page will open correctly on the Edit Mode.

h3. Actual Results

After a few seconds (when confluence connects to the Sync server), the template will brake, showing some extra lines.

h3. Notes

Despite the extra lines, the page can be saved correctly.

h3.Workaround

Use other browsers. E.g: Firefox.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If users are using Chrome v55 or Safari 9.1.2, the editor will take between 10 and 20 seconds to open.

Also, in the same affected instances, the Inline Comment is not working. It will load and suddenly, will popup an issue with the Editor not loading properly.
h3. Environment
 * Chrome v55
 * Safari 9.1.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Confluence page and click on the *Edit* button while using either of these two browsers versions.

For Inline Comments:
 # Select a portion of text in the page.
 # Click on the Comment Icon. 

h3. Expected Results

The Editor loads almost instantly.

For the Inline Comments: It should display a pop-up to insert a comment.
h3. Actual Results

The Editor takes more than 10 seconds to load and the following error is thrown in the console:
 !Screen Shot 2016-12-15 at 15.39.55.png|thumbnail!

For the Inline Comment: 

The pop-up will keep loading and no results will be displayed:

!popup.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Only slowness witnessed when opening the Editor. The page can be edited and saved without any issues.
h3. Workaround

This does not happen on Firefox or on Chrome v54.
fields.summary: Editor takes more than 10 seconds to load and Inline Comment not work with Chrome v55 and Safari 9.1.2

Export error
Failed to upload application/zip file to filestore. Failure: Failure
{cause=null, reason=BAD_STATUS, message=' Service Unavailable The service is temporarily unavailable. Please try again later. ', httpStatusCode=500}

But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 2016-12-27T18:35:56.323-05:00
{noformat}
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

On a large Confluence site
 # create a backup with attachments

h3. Expected Results

Backup completes and is available for download from the filestore location
h3. Actual Results

An error is shown on screen.
h3. Notes

The backup itself was created and the process failed to upload it to the filestore location due to the service responding a 500 error message "Service Unavailable"
 The backup file on the /home/temp/ directory is removed soon after the process fails.
 Although the remote service is unavailable, it is not ideal for Confluence to fail without retrying at another time or saving the file locally for a longer period of time so a workaround can be provided to customers.
h3. Workaround

For testing purposes, creating a backup without attachments normally works as the file is significantly smaller.
fields.summary: Confluence Backup fails due to Media Api "Service Unavailable"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you export a space to PDF export using Custom Export, it ignores if a child page is selected or not if the parent page is selected.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud Version: 1000.518.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a Space, select *PDF*
 # Select *Custom Export*
 # Select a parent page and deselect the child pages under it.

h3. Expected Results

It should only export the selected page.
h3. Actual Results

It is exporting the child pages of the selected parent page even if you deselect the child pages during the export.
fields.summary: PDF custom export ignores if a child page is selected or not if the parent page is selected.

fields.description:
I received an email notification saying that Amber had added an inline comment to my page on product-fabric.atlassian.net (prod Confluence Cloud). I clicked the view comment button, it opened the page, but no comment was shown. I checked the text that the comment was supposedly added to, and it wasn't there. The comment is also not in the page comments. It's simply not there.

See attached gif.
fields.summary: Email notification about an inline comment that doesn't exist

fields.description:
{panel}A fix for this issue is included in Confluence Cloud 1000.583.1 which should now be deployed to all production Cloud instances. If you're still experiencing this issue please open a support case via support.atlassian.com. {panel} h3. Summary On pages where inline comments are present, it is not possible to use the buttons on the right hand side of the page (preventing comments to be added, as well as watching a space, or using the more button). h3. Steps to Reproduce # Add inline comments to a page. # Enter some text in the comment text box. # Try to click on the *Save* button. h3. Expected Results The comment is added to the page correctly. h3. Actual Results Nothing happens when trying to click on the buttons *Save*, *Preview*, or *Cancel* h3. Notes Reproducible on all browsers. When looking at the development tools in Chrome, you can see an empty div where the buttons are unclickable:
h3. Workaround Use Ctrl+s (Cmd+s on Mac) to add the comment. When loading the page, the buttons are clickable for a short period (less than 2 seconds) allowing you to access the additional options.
fields.summary: Unable to use right hand side buttons on pages with inline comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Table of Contents* macro is not displayed when viewing the Confluence page from JIRA Service Desk knowledge base.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Place a *Table of Contents* macro in a Confluence page that is part of a Service Desk knowledge base.
# Visit that page from within the Service Desk knowledge base

h3. Expected Results
The *Table of Contents* macro is displayed properly on the knowledge base.

h3. Actual Results
The *Table of Contents* macro is not displayed on the page and no error are thrown in the browser console.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Table of Contents is not displayed when viewing from Knowledge Base

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In some pages in Confluence, the user will intermittently not be able to place a cursor in page edit mode.

h3. Environment
1000.288.1 Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the problematic page, click edit to go into editing mode.
# Attempt to place your cursor on the page. 

h3. Expected Results
The cursor should be able to be placed and the user can continue editing.

h3. Actual Results
The cursor is not possible to be placed anywhere on the page.

h3. Notes
Most of the pages seem to have a hyphen in the title, but there are a few that do not have one.
It may be related to collaborative editing, all examples so far have it.

h3.Workaround
Edit the page, save without changes.
Go back to the page, and attempt to edit. If it still does not work, you may need to back out and try again.
fields.summary: Intermittently unable to place cursor in page edit mode

fields.description:
h3. {color:#ff0000}{color}Summary

Confluence is sending multiple notification emails to customers.
h3. How to Replicate
 # Login into any instance and make an update on a page.
 # Wait for the email notification
 # Confluence will flood users with the same notification (every 10min or so)

 
h3. Workaround:
 * Triggering a Confluence restart *might* temporarily fix the problem

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *Page Tree* macro is now displaying all pages from a space, rather than starting at the specified root page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.498.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any page of a space that has multiples parents and children.

h3. Expected Results
As stated per the documentation ([Page Tree macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-tree-macro-724765260.html]), 
_The Page Tree macro displays a dynamic, hierarchical list of pages starting from a specified parent (root) page_. 

h3. Actual Results
The *Page Tree* macro displays all pages from the space. 

h3.Workaround
Atlassian Cloud support can disable the macro if it causes the instance to go down.
fields.summary: Page Tree macro is displaying all pages from a space (potentially causing large instances to crash)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

{{@mention}} complement doesn't show expected candidates for a particular user.
 This is possibly related to the user status.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud 1000.929.0
 * Modern browsers such as Google Chrome 55.0.2883.95 (64-bit)
 * The affected instance doesn't use proxies

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Confluence as an affected user
 # Open an arbitrary edit page
 # Try {{@mention}} completion

h3. Expected Results

The candidates show up correctly.
h3. Actual Results

No candidate shows up.
 * The HAR file contains the history to the {{[https://chatwork.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/mentions/latest/service/token]}} but not to the {{[https://pf-mentions-service.atlassian.io/mentions/search?query=]}}.

h3. Notes
 * This happens to the user after -CONF-45633- was fixed but it's not verified these two issues are related.
 * When an affected user opens a edit page, the browser shows a message saying {{PropertyPanel.destroy: called with no current PropertyPanel, returning}}.

h3. Workaround

_[Insert a text link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/links-724764897.html#Links-Insertatextlink]_ works similar to mention.
fields.summary: @mention complement doesn't work well for a particular user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When moving a page to a new space, the *Parent Field* is left blank which will create an orphaned page on the space if not set to an existing page. This is problematic as orphaned pages do not come up in the *Page tree* as they are not under the main parent page.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any Confluence page and select *Move* in the operation menu in the top right.

h3. Expected Results
The *Parent page* field should not accept empty value in order to prevent the creation of orphaned pages.

h3. Actual Results
The *Parent page* field is blank and a page can be moved without setting a parent therefore creating an orphaned page.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: New parent page is left blank when moving a page to a different space

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create page and add title with apostrophe.
# Add Livesearch macro to the page.
# Save page.
# Search the title with apostrophe.

h3. Expected Behavior
Apostrophe displays correctly.

h3. Actual Behavior
 apostrophe instead displays: {noformat}'{noformat}

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Livesearch Macro search results displays ' instead of apostrophe

fields.description:
h3. How to Replicate
 # With a user with profile language in English, log in
 # Create a page and add a date with '//'
 # Save
 # The dates will be correct, with the chosen date
 # Change the profile page to 'French'
 # Check the page, the dates will be one day back
 # Add other pages/dates, they will be all one day back.
fields.summary: Date lozenges display incorrectly if user locales are not US or UK

fields.description:
h2. Summary

User created a blogpost with Cyrillic characters as title, after creating it user unable to view it.
h2. Steps to replicate
 # Create a blogpost with this title *Командировки*
 # Save it

h2. Observed Behaviour

User unable to view the blogpost they created with Cyrillic characters as title.
h2. Expected Behaviour

User should be able to view the blogpost

h2. Note

If the title is mixed up with unicode characters and normal characters, the problem didn't happen.

h2. Workaround

Update the title with normal characters (or normal characters + unicode characters).
fields.summary: Unable to view blogpost if the title contains only unicode characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to add a label for blog posts.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Single Page App (SPA) enabled

h3. Step to reproduce
# Go to a blog post
# Attempt to  add a label
# Use keyboard shortcut *L* to add a label

h3. Expected Result
"Labels" screen pops up for users to add the labels

h3. Actual Result
Pencil icon is not showing for the *Label* section. Nothing happens when using keyboard shortcut *L.
fields.summary: Can't Add Label to Blog Post on Single Page App

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Every time the user access a Space he needs to click on Pages tab to get the page tree.
h3. Environment

Reproduced on
 * Safari
 * Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Space.
 # Click on Pages to open the page tree
 # Go to another Space
 # Go back to the Space you've accessed the page tree

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should remember the user have accessed Pages before and open it once the user comes back to the Space
h3. Actual Results

Confluence always opens Overview when you access a Space.
 
h3. Workaround

For now, there is nor workaround
fields.summary: User need to click on Pages every time he goes to a Space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new Confluence interface, if the user accessing the Space does not have view permission over the main page, the Overview tab keeps loading and the entire page refreshes in the browser over and over again.

h3. Environment
Cloud with SPA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Confluence with new interface
# Create a user
# Set a Space with a main page that the user does not have access to (No view permission).
# Log with this user account and refer to this space.

h3. Expected Results
A message should appear saying the page does not exist or the user does not have access.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing shows up and the page keeps refreshing.
 
h3.Workaround
Grant the user view permission over the main page.
fields.summary: Accessing Confluence Space overview causes the page to refresh

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When user creating JIRA issue from confluence by higlighting, one of their required field *Target Version* displaying all versions together with Archived versions.
h2. Steps to replicate
 # Create a test project in JIRA
 # Add a few versions in that project (e.g Test 1 , Test 2 and Test 3)
 # Create a custom field name *Target Version [version picker (single picker)]*
 # Make the *Target version* field as required
 # Archive Test 1 version
 # Go to a confluence page and highlight any wordings, click on the create JIRA issue dialog.
 # Choose the test project and see the dropdown list

h2. Observed Behaviour

The dropdown list display all version although *Test 1* version is Archive.
h2. Expected Behaviour

Archived version should not be display on the dropdown list
fields.summary: Create JIRA issue in Confluence displaying archive versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Contributor Summary macro is added to the page, but it's showing an empty table (no result).

h3. Environment
Cloud Version - 1000.0.0-464929ea040

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page
# Add Contributor Summary macro > Save
# Edit the page then save
# Comment on the page

h3. Expected Result
All changes are updated on the macro and show in table format.

h3. Actual Result
Contributor Summary macro is not updated at all.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Contributor Summary Macro Not Working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In previous Confluence versions it was possible to save blog pages with the same name in the same space if the user saved them in different days.
In the current version it's not possible to do so.

h3. Environment
Cloud - v.1000.1090.1 -> not working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a blog post in different days with the same name.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should save the page.

h3. Actual Results
The page can't be saved because an error occurs telling the customer a page with the same name already exists.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Can't save blog posts with same name

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a new Confluence instance
 # Go through onboarding

Expected behaviour:

Header is a single blue bar

Actual behaviour:

Header is a double blue bar

Notes:

Uncaught Error: undefined missing confluence/api/event found in Chrome console
fields.summary: Onboarding to Confluence header is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a new page, you have the ability to associate a label with it. With the *Collaborative Editing* feature enabled, once a label is placed, the page will come up in the label search if the automated indexing jobs ran at that time.
This can cause some security issue for draft of pages that have yet to have restrictions applied to them.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud 1000.1070.1 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page on an instance with *Collaborative Editing* turned ON.
# Apply a label on that draft.

h3. Expected Results
The draft does not come up in the label search or in any macros filtering by label until the page is published.

h3. Actual Results
The draft shows up in the label search or any macros filtering by label.
 
h3.Workaround
Apply page restrictions as soon as you create the page so that only users with the right to view the page will see it in the label results.
fields.summary: Labelled draft pages are coming up in the label search when the Collaborative Editing feature is enabled
